drug.name: Ubenimex
drug.description: Ubenimex (also known as bestatin) is a competitive protease inhibitor. It is an inhibitor of aminopeptidase B, leukotriene A4 hydrolase, aminopeptidase N. It is being studied for use in the treatment of acute myelocytic leukemia.

article.citation: Scornik OA, Botbol V: Bestatin as an experimental tool in mammals. Curr Drug Metab. 2001 Mar;2(1):67-85.
Yoneda J, Saiki I, Fujii H, Abe F, Kojima Y, Azuma I: Inhibition of tumor invasion and extracellular matrix degradation by ubenimex (bestatin). Clin Exp Metastasis. 1992 Jan;10(1):49-59.
Bauvois B, Dauzonne D: Aminopeptidase-N/CD13 (EC 3.4.11.2) inhibitors: chemistry, biological evaluations, and therapeutic prospects. Med Res Rev. 2006 Jan;26(1):88-130.
Wickstrom M, Larsson R, Nygren P, Gullbo J: Aminopeptidase N (CD13) as a target for cancer chemotherapy. Cancer Sci. 2011 Mar;102(3):501-8. doi: 10.1111/j.1349-7006.2010.01826.x. Epub 2011 Jan 30.

drug.synthesis-reference: Hamao Umezawa, Takaaki Aoyagi, Tomio Takeuchi, Masa Hamada, Yoshiro Okami, "Biologically active substance, bestatin, and production thereof." U.S. Patent US4052449, issued October 04, 1977.
drug.indication: An adjuvant therapy used for acute and chronic myelonous leukemia, lung cancer and nasopharyngeal cancer. It is also used to treat hypercholesterolaemia.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as hybrid peptides. These are compounds containing at least two different types of amino acids (alpha, beta, gamma, delta) linked to each other through a peptide bond.

drug-interaction.name: Picosulfuric acid
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Picosulfuric acid can be decreased when used in combination with Ubenimex.

drug-interaction.name: BCG vaccine
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of BCG vaccine can be decreased when used in combination with Ubenimex.

drug-interaction.name: Typhoid vaccine
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Typhoid vaccine can be decreased when used in combination with Ubenimex.

drug-interaction.name: Dicoumarol
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Dicoumarol.

drug-interaction.name: Phenindione
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Phenindione.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Warfarin.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Acenocoumarol.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Coumarin.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with (R)-warfarin.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Ethyl biscoumacetate.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Clorindione.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Ubenimex is combined with Diphenadione.

drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Lactulose can be decreased when used in combination with Ubenimex.

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Leukotriene A-4 hydrolase
polypeptide.specific-function: Epoxide hydrolase that catalyzes the final step in the biosynthesis of the proinflammatory mediator leukotriene B4. Has also aminopeptidase activity.

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Solute carrier family 15 member 1
polypeptide.general-function: Proton-dependent oligopeptide secondary active transmembrane transporter activity
polypeptide.specific-function: Proton-coupled intake of oligopeptides of 2 to 4 amino acids with a preference for dipeptides. May constitute a major route for the absorption of protein digestion end-products.

go-classifier.description: proton-dependent oligopeptide secondary active transmembrane transporter activity

article.citation: Terada T, Sawada K, Irie M, Saito H, Hashimoto Y, Inui K: Structural requirements for determining the substrate affinity of peptide transporters PEPT1 and PEPT2. Pflugers Arch. 2000 Sep;440(5):679-84.

polypeptide.name: Solute carrier family 15 member 2
polypeptide.specific-function: Proton-coupled intake of oligopeptides of 2 to 4 amino acids with a preference for dipeptides.
